results.title: The Hand of death = Shaolin men
results.creator_credit: Raymond Chow, Golden Harvest and John Woo
results.brief_description: John Woo wrote and directed this action film starring Jackie Chan, Samo Hung, Dorian Tan and James Tien. Following the breakup of their group after an invasion from the rival Manchus, 8 Shaolin renegades form their own resistance group. They train under their old leader, until he deems them ready enough to challenge the Manchus and save the Chung Dynasty. Poorly dubbed into English.

results.title: The Hand
results.brief_description: Intriguing study of a hand as it evolves rather frenetically into a hairy being with a life of its own. No dialogue - distorted and scratchy sound effects.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SOUND]
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, W H Productions, Mack Sennett Comedies and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: A burlesque of the famous poem by Hugh Antoine D’Arcy of the broken-down artist who, having lost his wife to another man, draws her face on the floor and then passes out, drunk. Sound version with piano accompaniament.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett, Keystone Film Company, Mack Sennett Comedies and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: The plot is a satire derived from Hugh Antoine D’Arcy’s poem “The Face on the bar room floor. It tells of the broken-down artist (Charlie Chaplin) who, having lost his wife (Cecile Arnold) to another man, draws her face on the floor of a bar room. Charlie tells his tragic story in flashbacks. NB: Silent film with no soundtrack.
results.title_for_label: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]

results.title: The Half-masted schooner
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and Bruce Mackay
results.brief_description: A film combining a tuneful ballad with an equally engaging kaleidoscope of pictures, some relating to the story of the song and some not, but all most cheering and amusing to the eye. The soft focus of the live photography and the pleasing patterns of abstract designs combine with the relaxed mood of the ballad to produce an agreeable interlude of sights and sounds. Spawned from the hippy experimental culture of the time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and Bruce Mackay

results.title: The Hairy bird
results.creator_credit: Alliance Communications, Redeemable Features, Ira Deutchman, Peter Newman and Sarah Kernochan
results.brief_description: A fun romp set in 1960s middle-class white America, in a private girls’ school that is set to become co-educational. Odette is a new student and finds herself a fish-out-of-water until she embraces her new roommates and friends learning of the girls’ secret society - the D.A.R. (Daughters of American Ravioli) a reference to the cans of cold pasta they pilfer from the school kitchens via their secret attic dwelling. The girls go about ruining the imposed decision that they merge with the boys at St Ambrose by sabotaging the school dance and becoming politically active, much to the pleasure of the strict but approachable headmistress (Lynn Redgrave). At Miss Godard’s School for Girls this coming-of-age tale is full of sass and toe-tapping fun. Written and directed by Sarah Kernochan. Cast includes: Kirsten Dunst, Gaby Hoffman, Rachel Leigh Cook, Vincent Kartheiser, Monica Keena, Heather Matarazzo, and Merritt Wever.

results.title: The Hairdresser's husband = Le Mari del la coiffeuse
results.creator_credit: Lambart Productions, TFI and Patrice Leconte
results.brief_description: Death is yellow and smells of vanilla pronounces Antoine, the protagonist of this sunny and optimistic film in which even something sombre is imagined as radiant and sweet. Photographed in glowing primary colours, with some scenes shot in slight slow-motion, this study of male erotic obsession is a lazy, dreamy film about nothing more than a state of being - happiness. Cocooned in their little one-roomed store, Antoine and Mathilde, his luminous wife are sufficient to themselves. Two wonderful performances from Jean Rochefort and Anna Galiena are complemented by the Arab music Antoine loves and original music by Michael Nyman.

results.title: The Hague - Holland
results.creator_credit: Hans Vos, Carrilon Films, Holland and Caspar Willers
results.brief_description: The capital of the Netherlands is a felicitous mixture of the old and the new. The film explores the city and the cultural and international events that take place there.

results.title: The Hacktivists [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Hilton Cordell, Dominant 7, Chris Hilton, Peter Day, Laurnet Bocahut and Ian Walker
results.brief_description: This documentary - an Australian/French co-production - examines Internet based civil action and protests, and the individuals who invent and co-ordinate such exploits. Known as hacktivists, the intention of these protestors is to disrupt business, such as e-commerce and prevent websites from operating effectively. The hacktivists (who range across the globe) are principally concerned with globalisation and capitalism. Their perception is that they are modern dissidents whose activities sit alongside, even boost and support, traditional forms of street protest. In this documentary, several hacktivists are interviewed, discussing their aims, politics and methodology, which may include bombarding companies with emails or performing cyber sit-ins, immobilising a website. These activities are not only effective but also pose a danger to big corporations with net-based trade. There are also interviews with the Canadian police and a cyber expert employed by companies to anticipate and undermine hacktivist activities. One mission of online activism is to explain the philosophy to ordinary people and encourage them to take part. Electro-hippies (as they are known) believe that electronic forms of protest will become even more effective as their methods improve and e-commerce expands. The war looks set to continue.

results.title: The Gypsy moth
results.brief_description: The uncontrolled spread of the gypsy moth is creating a serious problem that is difficult to estimate economically. In this film the audience sees the type and extent of the damage caused by these prolific insects, as well as the ease with which they are transported from one area to another by unsuspecting humans. The moth was introduced to North America from Europe in 7869 by a scientist, and has now spread with insufficient naturel predators, thereby causing great damage to Canada’s forests and crops. Superb photography.
